cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across western Cuba, then turning northwest toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Texas–Louisiana border) by late Wednesday, and inland toward the mid-Mississippi Valley by Friday/Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast (around the Texas–Louisiana border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning currently limited to Cuban provinces, Little Cayman & Cayman Brac, and the Florida Keys (Craig Key to Dry Tortugas).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Cuban southern and western coastline, Little Cayman & Cayman Brac, Florida Keys.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama expected to receive hurricane conditions and storm surge mid-week.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Great-Lakes sites listed in advisory table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Detroit; only a brief period of breezy conditions (20–25 mph) possible this weekend as remnants pass well south-east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rainfall (0.5–1.0 inch) possible late 29–30 Aug from remnant moisture plume.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor disruption to river/Great-Lakes barge schedules possible if upstream rainfall raises Ohio River levels, but direct impacts to Detroit port operations are unlikely.
